attributes.action: Give Harrogate a better train service to London
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Harrogate has a service to London King's Cross (currently departing at 07:28 Mon-Fri and 07:44 Sat), but NO return working!  Granted, one can change at Leeds or York, but this is not ideal.  I believe the last through train from London to Harrogate was mid 1970s.  However if a little creative thinking was employed, there could be a couple of London-Harrogate trains each day very easily:

The line from Leeds to Harrogate to just north of York is not electrified, which means HSTs must be used (or an electric set hauled by a diesel loco).  Some extra trains (HST - diesel) have been procured for the enhanced Leeds-London service.  Due to capacity constraints on the Leeds-Wakefield-Doncaster route, some Leeds-London trains will have to operate via Hambleton.

If the DfT wanted, they could have trains operate as follows: London-Doncaster-Wakefield-Leeds (reverse)-Horsforth-Harrogate-Knaresborugh-York-Doncaster-London.

Given that a train from London terminating in Harrogate is unattractive to DfT and GNER (as the past 30-ish years ave shown), maybe a train leaving Leeds, going via Harrogate and York to London (and/or vice versa), would be?
